coredata.dc:title: Electronic structure of CuCr2S4 by XPS, XANES and EXAFS
coredata.dc:creator: Lenglet, M.
Foulatier, P.
D'Huysser, A.
Jørgensen, C.K.
Dürr, J.
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
The present paper reports the K X-ray absorption spectra of copper and chromium and XPS spectra (Cu2p
3 2
, Cr2p
3 2
and S2p levels) in the copper-chromium chalcogenide spinel CuCr2S4. From XAS measurements (chemical shift of the K absorption discontinuity of copper and Cr-S distance) and XPS study (at 293 and 493 K) one can conclude in a valence distribution: Cu+[Cr2-x
3+Cr x
4+]S4 with two inequivalent sulfur atoms.

LENGLET, P. FOULATIER Laboratoire de Physicochimie des Materiaux, INSA de Rouen, BR 08, 76131 Mont-Saint-Aignan Cedex, France A. D HUYSSER Laboratoire de Catalyse Heterogene, UA 402. USTL Lilie L 59655 Villeneuve d Ascq, France C.K. JORGENSEN Departement de Chimie Minerale, Analytique et Appliquee, Universite de Geneve, CH-1211 Geneva 4, Switzerland and J. DURR ENS TIMD, 941. Rue C. Bourseul, 59500 Douai, France Received 5 January 1988 The present paper reports the K X-ray absorption spectra of copper and chromium and XPS spectra (Cu2p3,2, Cr2p312 and S2p levels) in the copper chromium chalcogenide spinel CuCr2S4. From XAS measurements (chemical shift of the K absorption discontinuity of copper and Cr S distance) and XPS study (at 293 and 493 K) one can conclude in a valence distribution: Cut [Cr~t~Cr~t ]S~ with two incquivalcnt sulfur atoms. The purpose of this Letter is to clarify the elec- tronic structure of CuCr2S4 by means of XPS and XAS studies. Among the chalcogenide spinels, the chromium spinels have been thoroughly investigated because of their peculiar properties: the p-type me- tallic conductivity, the saturation magnetization (~ 5 JIB) and the high Curie temperatures (420 K and 4.58 JIB, 460 K and 4.94 MB, 365 K and 4.94 MB, for the sulfide, selenide and telluride, respectively [1,2)). Different models for the electronic structure of CuCr2X4 (see table 1) have been proposed to ex- plain these properties. The crucial point in the Lotgering model is the te- travalent state of Cr. This interpretation predicts the occurrence of mixed valence Cr3t C? + in CuCr2S4 and CuCr2Se4. A comparison of the electrical and magnetic properties of CuCr2X4 and related chaI- cogenide spinels [9,10] (CuCr2_~Ti~S4, CuCr2_~ Snss4, CuCr2_~Rh~Se4 and CuCr03Rh1 .7_~Sn~Se4) may be made. CuCr2S4 is a ferromagnet with a Curie Table 1 Ionic configurations proposed in the literature for CuCr2X4 (X=S, Se) temperature of 420 K, so that the XPS measure- ments were carried out in the ferromagnetic and par- amagnetic states, respectively at 293 and 493 K, with a AEI ES 200 B spectrometer using a non-mono- chromatized Al Ka X-ray source. No change has been observed in this temperature range on the Cu2p312, Cr2p312 and 52p lines, whose observed binding ener 0 009-26 14/88/$ 03.50 Elsevier Science Publishers B.V. (North-Holland Physics Publishing Division) 139 Volume 145, number 2 CHEMICAL PHYSICS LEITERS 25 March 1988 Table 2 XPS experimental data in some sulfides Compounds Cu2p3,2 Cr2p,,2 S2p Ref. E11 E5 EB (eV) fwhm (ev) CuCr2S4 932.7 1.6 575.3 161.4 this study ZnCr2S4 575.3 161.5 this study CuCrS2 932 574.8 [11] Cu095Fe005Cr2S4 931.2 1.3 575 161 [12] Cu2Se 932.3 2.2 [13] Cu2S 932 1.15 162.3 [14] CuCr2O4 a936 ~3 576.5 gies are given in table 2 compared with values ob tained on other sulfides. The spectrum of the Cu2p level Consists of two spin orbit components Cu2p112 and Cu2p312without satellite structure indicative of Cu2~ [15]. One can conclude that copper is in the monovalent state. The chromium 2p levels have exactly the same binding energies in CuCr2S4 and ZnCr2S4. ZnCr2S4 contains exclusively Cr3 + in h environment. Nevertheless one cannot exclude the presence of chromium (IV) for each or all the following reasons: (j) The XPS spectral features of the Cr4~ species surrounded by sulfur may approach those of the Cr~ species. These features are not available in the lit erature and it could only be mentioned here that the chemical shift between + 3 and + 4 oxidation states 165 160 ev is slight in oxides (cO.5 eV) [16,17]. (ii) The Cr4~ species may be in small quantities compared to the Cr3~ species. The S2p spectrum of Fig. 1. S2p photo-electron spectra in ZnCr2S4 (a) and CuCr2S4 (b). CuCr2S4, but not that of ZnCr2S4 (fig. 1), has a pro nounced tail at the high binding energy side. The Table 3 Chemical shifts of Cr Kjl emission spectra and K absorption discontinuities in CuCr2S4 and reference compounds CuCr2O4 CuCr2S4 C0Cr2S4 X-ray emission spectra CrKII ~K131,3 (eV) +0.63 ~ +0.64 ~ X-ray absorption spectra CrK edge L~EK (eV) 9 b) 9.05 c~ 6.8 ~ 8 ~ 6.7 b), 6.25 ~ CuK edge ~EK (eV) 5.7 ), 60 2.04 c>, <1 d) Ref. [19]. b)Ref [20]. C)Ref [21]. d)J~hj55t~~y e)Ref [22]. Ref, [23]. 140 Volume 145, number 2 CHEMICAL PHYSICS LETTERS 25 March 1988 Fig. 2. K X-ray absorption spectra of Cu in metal, CuCr2O4 and CuCr2S4. asymmetric broadening of S2p spectrum and the en- hanced intensity of S2p112 component in CuCr2S4 may be correlated with the presence of two inequiv- aient sulfur atoms as in a number of metallic copper sulfides [14,18]. The results of our measurements on the K X-ray absorption discontinuity of copper and chromium in metals, in CuCr2S4 and in some other compounds of known valcncy are given in table 3. The X-ray absorption K edge of Cu in CuCr2S4 (fig. 2) is characteristic of Cu(I) in a tetrahedral envi- ronment (chemical shift and fine structure [24]). Leonardt and Meisel [25] consider that an excel- lent correlation can be established between the chemical shifts of Cr K emission lines and the oxi- dation numbers for chromium compounds with identical anions so that the Cr Kf31,3 energy shifts can be used for identification of the oxidation state [19,26]. The chemical shifts of the Cr Kss13 line [19] and K( 1 s) absorption edge of chromium in CrCu2S4 Table 4 Cation anion distances in CuCr2S4 Fig. 3. K X-ray absorption spectra of Cr in metal, CuCr2S4 and CoCr2S4. with respect to metal are indicative of Cr(III) pre- dominant in this compound (fig. 3). The X-ray absorption spectra of CuCr2S4 have been recorded in the transmission mode at room temper- ature for Cu and Cr K edge owing to the availability of the LURE synchrotron radiation sources, Orsay, France. The EXAFS oscillations are perfectly repro- duced using a Cr O distance 2.39 A and the param- eters given in table 4. The Cr~ S2 distance in all thiochromites except CuCr2S4 is 2.41 0.01 A. The cation anion distance determined by EXAFS, 2.39 0.02 A, is larger than those from X-ray diffraction measurements. This re- suit is in agreement with the conclusion deduced from X-ray spectrometry measurements. In conclusion, CuCr2S4 is a mixed valence com- pound according to the model of Lotgering Cu + [Cr~ t~Cr? ] S~ with two inequivalent sulfur at- oms (however, Cr( III) seems widely predominant). ce:abstract-sec.ce:simple-para:
The present paper reports the K X-ray absorption spectra of copper and chromium and XPS spectra (Cu2p
3 2
, Cr2p
3 2
and S2p levels) in the copper-chromium chalcogenide spinel CuCr2S4. From XAS measurements (chemical shift of the K absorption discontinuity of copper and Cr-S distance) and XPS study (at 293 and 493 K) one can conclude in a valence distribution: Cu+[Cr2-x
3+Cr x
4+]S4 with two inequivalent sulfur atoms.
